results.title: Pink Floyd - The Wall
results.creator_credit: Gerald Scarfe, Allan Parker, Alan Marshall, Goldcrest and Tin Blue
results.brief_description: Pink Floyd’s landmark album was translated into an original rock music motion picture experience. Bob Geldof plays Pink, a burnt out rock superstar who thinks he is going mad inside a room at a Los Angeles hotel. The film takes us on a downward spiral into Pink’s hell. Live action is intercut with brilliant animation by Gerald Scarfe and the soundtrack by Pink Floyd has given this film its cult status.

results.title: Pingu: Pingu and his friends
results.creator_credit: PINGU B V NL and Pingu Filmstudio
results.brief_description: Pingu and his family and friends invite you to join them in ten of their stories of fun and games. Stories on the tape include: ‘Pingu plays ice hockey’; ‘Pingu and Pinga don’t want to go to bed’; ‘Pingu on the makeshift skis’; ‘Pingu runs away from home’; ‘Pingu builds an igloo’; ‘Pingu has music lessons from his grandfather’; ‘Pingu in the ice cave’; ‘Pingu’s tobogganing’; ‘Pingu’s grandfather is sick’; ‘Pingu at school’.

results.title: Pingu the magician
results.creator_credit: Otmar Gutman, Pingu Filmstudio and PINGU B V NL
results.brief_description: Pingu and his family and friends invite you join them in ten of their stories of fun and games. Stories on the tape include: ‘Pingu the magician’; ‘Pingu’s curling party’; ‘Pingu as an icicle player’; ‘Pingu’s outing’; ‘Pingu and the camera’; ‘Pingu’s parent’s have no time’; ‘Pingu and the packaging material’; ‘Pingu at the fairground’; ‘Pingu cannot lose’; and ‘Pingu and the disabled penguin’.

results.title: Pingu
results.brief_description: Pingu is a BAFTA award-winning British-Swiss stop-motion claymated television series created by Otmar Gutmann.

constellations_other.name: Storytime animated
constellations_other.description: Abra Cadabra was the world's first stereoscopic 3D film, but animators and filmmakers had experimented with the technology far earlier and continue to use other older techniques like stop-motion animation.

results.description:
Pingu is a BAFTA award-winning British-Swiss stop-motion claymated television series created by Otmar Gutmann. The series was produced by The Pygos Group and Trickfilmstudio for Swiss television, and centers on a family of anthropomorphic penguins living at the South Pole. The main character is the family’s son and title character, Pingu. The show was made by HiT Entertainment and HoT Animation, British companies, from seasons 5–6.

The show originally ran for fourteen seasons from 28 May 1986 to 9 April 2000 on SF DRS. In 2001, there were 2 Pingu episodes made that did not air during the original run. The episodes were run later, in 2000, as part of a Pingu marathon. HiT Entertainment’s request for more episodes convinced Pygos to bring back the show in 1998, with two more series. Of note, season 1 and season 2 were run consecutively but took 4 years for each season to complete, while season 3 and season 4 took 2 and 3 years to complete – the show was not cancelled in between. To this day, Pingu maintains a cult following, and enjoys occasional reruns on Cbeebies in the United Kingdom. It aired on BBC in 1995 until 2005 through the early years.
description_for_label:
Pingu is a BAFTA award-winning British-Swiss stop-motion claymated television series created by Otmar Gutmann. The series was produced by The Pygos Group and Trickfilmstudio for Swiss television, and centers on a family of anthropomorphic penguins living at the South Pole. The main character is the family’s son and title character, Pingu. The show was made by HiT Entertainment and HoT Animation, British companies, from seasons 5–6.

The show originally ran for fourteen seasons from 28 May 1986 to 9 April 2000 on SF DRS. In 2001, there were 2 Pingu episodes made that did not air during the original run. The episodes were run later, in 2000, as part of a Pingu marathon. HiT Entertainment’s request for more episodes convinced Pygos to bring back the show in 1998, with two more series. Of note, season 1 and season 2 were run consecutively but took 4 years for each season to complete, while season 3 and season 4 took 2 and 3 years to complete – the show was not cancelled in between. To this day, Pingu maintains a cult following, and enjoys occasional reruns on Cbeebies in the United Kingdom. It aired on BBC in 1995 until 2005 through the early years.

results.title: Ping Pong
results.brief_description: Ping Pong is a 2002 sports film directed by Japanese filmmaker Fumihiko Sori. It is based on Taiyō Matsumoto’s manga of the same name and is about the friendship between two high school table tennis players.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

results.description: As children, the introverted Smile was being bullied by a gang of kids until the brash Peco comes by and chases all of them them away. Peco then takes Smile under his wings and teaches him how to play the game of ping pong. From there a life long best friend relationship comes into existence between these two polar opposite kids. Fast forward a decade later, these two best friends try to deal with their own inner turmoils, as they move further and further into the regional ping pong tournament. Peco has to overcome a knee injury while trying to rediscover the fun aspects of the game of Ping Pong. Meanwhile, Smile now seems to have gained the killer instinct by going through a rigorous training regiment instilled by his high school coach. As the tournament progresses it becomes more likely that these two best friends will face off against each in the final match.

results.title: Ping Pong
results.brief_description: An experimental abstract film. Animated sketches form and dissolve to background of music by percussion instruments. Stick figures and leg outlines glide and dance, flit and disintegrate into hail, through which a little girl wends with her umbrella. Occasionally the lively lines weaves into shapes that suggest the background of cymbals and drums.

results.title: Ping pong
results.creator_credit: Marcel Carriere and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The National Film Board of Canada filmed the table tennis competition between teams of young Canadians and Chinese that took place in the People’s Republic of China in the summer of 1973, the first time in twenty-five years that such filming was made possible. Shown are highlights of play at the China-Canada Friendship Meet, as well as some of the sightseeing taken in by the young Canadians - a visit, for example, to the Great Wall of China. A film without commentary.

results.title: Pine ways to profit
results.brief_description: The pine farmers in the South are learning to protect their forest as another source of income. The wood is used as chips, pulp, turpentine, poles, posts and stumps. They are at most risk from fire and prevention and cooperation between fire preventers and neighbours is essential. Methods of prevention and protection for seedlings are shown.

results.title: Pine Gap images
results.brief_description: A celebrations of documented images of the women’s protest camp at Pine Gap, Australian Northern Territory in November 1983. A series of images representing the feeling of some of the women acting for qualitative change and for world peace. A discussion starter about non-violent protest action.

results.title: Pin up girl
results.creator_credit: Bruce Humberstone, William Le Baron and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Gorgeous Betty Grable (voted the Armed Forces’ favourite pin up girl), stars as a War Department typist, who doubles as a small-time USO entertainer desperate for a chance at the big-time. Her penchant for telling lies gets her into all sorts of trouble especially when she fibs her way into the company of war hero Tommy Dooley (John Harvey) by pretending to be a musical star. Her life gets more complicated when she is appointed secretary to the handsome war hero. Barely disguised, she manages to fool him for a time, but not when she flashes those million dollar legs! Grable turns in a wonderful performance and there are several excellent musical numbers.
